Topic.Title: Mayer's three year plan

Topic.Title: mm and yhoo made a mistake

Message.Msg: I do see what you are saying but it's not like they used up all of their cash - I don't see the issue here. But the opportunity for Tumblr happened through a series of discussions around partnerships. I think Mayer made the correct move in seizing the moment. If she hadn't FB would have - I don't care what the PR is on that. Tumblr layed off their entire Storyboard editorial staff last month - too expensive? not working the way Karp wanted ? who knows but FB/Sandberg grabbed at least one of the editors immediately - they were interested in Tumblr - they didn't get it - so now we will hear how they passed. Whatever. I dont't think Mayer was looking to spend 1B before the Alibaba IPO - but - they did have the cash & then as Eric Jackson pointed out, Alibaba did buy back the preferred shares Yahoo! held - another positive step towards the IPO - the cash was there the opportunity presented itself - it was the right thing to do.

Topic.Title: Just joined Tumblr Great Blog site

Does Yahoo sell search appliances/farm suites to government and corporate clients for use on their intranets? Not that I'm aware of. In nearly thirty years of military and government work I don't ever remember a Yahoo solution coming across my desk. Microsoft and Google; all the time on unclass all the way up to TS networks. Just search -google nsa court ties- even BING finds that!

Message.Title: Not a single "bigtime analyst" disapprove of YHOO-Tumblr deal
Message.Msg: It means their institutional clients will buy or increase their YHOO holdings. Plus this deal is broadcast or known around the world thus YHOO got a free worldwide recruitment starting from CNBC Cramer this morning. Cramer estimated about 800M+ got the deal news worldwide.

Message.Title: Yahoo! Unveils Flickr Overhaul, NY Office
Message.Msg: Yesterday turned out to be a very busy day for the new Yahoo!. First, the announcement, early on Monday that the Internet giant paid $1.1 billion to buy microblogging site Tumblr. Then, late Monday afternoon Yahoo! gathered a very small number of journalists in a hotel overlooking Times Square to make another two big announcements - the leasing of new space for a Yahoo! New York office and a complete upgrade of the company's popular Flickr photo sharing service.

Message.Title: rachel maddow vs alex jones
Message.Msg: Dear Ms Maddow: In response to your rant against Alex Jones: According to some of the many people who think independently, exclusively those who constantly not allow themselves to be brained washed by our illustrious metro media, you my poor lady have three strikes against you 1.) Your strong leanings to the extreme left are fascistic in temper (which in itself is a mental disorder) 2.) Your arrested development syndrome has morphed viruses into your psychological, sexual and spiritual hard drives with the possibility of perverting your operating system permanently. 3.) You are currently a cheerer and representative of The Megalomaniacal Media Corporate Global Complex…. (and the umpire says” 3 strikes Yourrrrrr`re… out!!!”) I admit we all are forever falling short from realm of perfection but really honey; you are headed down the road of dread and despair! If I were you I would be asking our God for immediate help! Just imagine! When looking into the future, is it not inevitable that you will become old with the distinct possibility that you could be left all alone with no one to love you? (Yikes, Dikes can you feel the spikes!) And when the globalist takeover finally settles in, assuredly you will be dismissed from prominence probably with very little warning, leaving you with much sadness and great anger and the realization that you have been used by largely assisting these 21st century vampires (corporate globalists) by espousing constantly night after night your left wing chatter. At that juncture the power elite will spit you out of like a rancid grape as they will no longer have a need for the services of your megaphoning tirades. And so time marches on into the future! The point is none of us are perfect and this author has enough faults of his or her own Regardless, in my alluding to the above; you have damned yourself by compromising both your character and soul for association with the enemies of humanity! Is it possible that by letting yourself be attracted to the putrefying scent of Satan’s malignant stench, in reality you have bartered away forever the most essential truths that lie within your soul? For your soul’s sake, I hope not. Go with God! For in the end; atheism leads to despair and without faith one`s life may end in vain! Although since it appears you do love animals and especially your dog; I will bet God has made it possible for you to revert from your witchy ideologies to championing the causes of true liberty and spirituality. With Godspeed Fellow earthling and fellow sinner (Ratia Americas Hutt)…

Topic.Title: It is a joke, that Yelp has the 50-fold market-cap and Tumblr the 27-fold price of Local Corp, but both less US-Monthly-Unique-Visitors (newest numbers from Siteanalytics)

Message.Msg: My advice: Sell all your Yelp-shares at once and 20% of your Yahoo-shares and buy for the amount shares of Local Corp.

Topic.Title: It is a joke, that Yelp has the 50-fold market-cap and Tumblr the 27-fold price of Local Corp, but both less US-Monthly-Unique-Visitors (newest numbers from Siteanalytics)

Message.Msg: Overview in newest 10-Q We are a local media advertising company that connects brick-and-mortar businesses with over a million online and mobile consumers each day using a variety of digital marketing products. Our Consumer Properties business unit consists of our O&O and Network division and reaches over 30 million monthly unique visitors. O&O consists primarily of our flagship property. Network operates a leading private label local syndication network of over 1,200 U.S. regional media websites and our own organic feed of local businesses along with third-party advertising feeds. Our Business Solutions business unit develops and supports products for use directly by small businesses. In January of 2013, we began offering these small business solutions exclusively through channel sales relationships we are developing. Our Business Solutions business unit also includes our Spreebird daily deals products. We use patented and proprietary technologies and systems to provide consumers with relevant search results for local businesses, products and services. By providing our users and those of our network partners with robust, current, local information about businesses and other offerings in their local area, we have attracted an audience of users that our direct advertisers and advertising partners desire to reach. We launched our flagship-site in August of 2005 and our local syndication network in July 2007. In the third quarter of 2010, we also acquired Octane360 which provided the technology platform for our SMB product suite. During the second quarter of 2011, we acquired Krillion which includes a robust local product search platform that enables consumers to search for products and product availability at local retailers. In the third quarter of 2011, we acquired SMG, a daily deals business, as part of our efforts to expand our own daily deals business, Spreebird, which we had launched in May 2011.

Topic.Title: It is a joke, that Yelp has the 50-fold market-cap and Tumblr the 27-fold price of Local Corp, but both less US-Monthly-Unique-Visitors (newest numbers from Siteanalytics)

Message.Msg: Key Takeaways from Q1’13 . • Sequential revenue growth from $20.9 million in Q4 to $21.8 million in Q1, up 4% • Margin expansion drove positive cash flow from operations one quarter ahead of schedule • Record traffic: » Overall traffic on the site and network was a record 106 million monthly unique visitors (MUV) » Organic traffic on the site was a record 49 million MUVs » Mobile traffic was 32 million MUVS for the first quarter 2013 • Costs savings due to cessation of direct sales efforts during 1Q • Made significant progress on key objectives for the year: » Expand gross margins on our largest revenue stream (O&O) – total gross margin up 4 points » Expand revenue of our highest gross margin business (Network) – Network ex TAC up 67% from prior year quarter • Reiterating prior guidance: » Revenue between $93 million and $95 million » Adjusted EBITDA of at least $5 million • Completed a $5 million convertible note financing in April 2013

Yahoo has a long way north to go this year and I don't think most people are even aware of AB yet outside of the yahoo circle. Once it is made known that people can play the most exciting IPO in years by owning Yahoo, demand for our shares will skyrocket.

Topic.Title: Any comments on the Flickr Redesign?

Message.Msg: I think they misread their current constituency. Maybe they're going for a whole new demographic, therefore. The site redesign is more for photo sharers than photographers. Most Flickr users liked to appreciate singular photos for their singularity, whatever the subject. The new site is described as "photocentric" but what they overlooked is that most Flickr users really appreciate easy access to context (sets, comments, maps, groups, etc.). Now, it's more a (much slower!) flood of images. To me, this redesign shows that Flickr developers are just concerned with AWESOMENESS, not functionality. There have been over 12,000 comments on the Flickr blog so far, most of them vehemently negative. Some members will defect to other services, but most will just adapt. So in the end, I doubt that push-back from that community will have much effect, fiscally.

Message.Msg: Ten new users will join for every one cry baby that leaves. I challenge you to find a better replacement. Good luck. How about Instagram? They don't even have a web sitel!! duh....

Topic.Title: Any comments on the Flickr Redesign?

Message.Msg: It's a disaster. The site is now unusable - seriously, this isn't a just redesign that people winge about but get used to, it really is unusable for anyone seriously wanting to display images - and the business model doesn't stack up. Yes they will pick up a few social networkers out for the free storage, but not many, facebook already got the social networking picture sharing marketand and I don't see the ad revenue making up for all the subscribers they are going to lose. Basically they threw away the USP of Flickr. Mayer is possibly the worst CEO I have ever seen and that's saying something.

Topic.Title: Not a single "bigtime analyst" disapprove of YHOO-Tumblr deal

Message.Msg: Market likes YHOO-Tumblr deal. No report of disapproval nor downgrade--yes yes. Well, well, well, another noted internet analyst Jason Helfstein of Oppenheimer raised his YHOO PT from $27 to $30. He said his upgrade is due primarily from Q4 results of Alibaba Group. He valued Alibaba at $72B. Also he mentioned that YHOO is being conservative in their next quarters earnings and revenue report. I can smell $30 to $35 per YHOO share this year baby!!

Topic.Title: Any comments on the Flickr Redesign?

Message.Msg: I really like it, no idea what some of you are seeing. What out there is better? The pictures are very well protected from downloading. I can't even right click on my own and pull them down??? Uncompressed is a huge benefit . I shoot in RAW and my pics look so much better My HDR pics now really look like HDR. My videos on Youtube and Picassa are simply pathetic, they are so compressed, on Flickr the quality is so much better. I also have Picassa and have some of the same sets and the shots on Flickr are so much better it is hardly a comparison. I for one am very happy with the change.

Topic.Title: Alibaba Pays Yahoo $838 Million For Preferred Shares, Clears Way For IPO

Message.Msg: Depends on the initial valuation (ie. the price that Yahoo has to sell 1/2 of its 24% stake at) and also what they decide to do with the remaining 12% (sell at the IPO price) or hold and ride the market price of Alibaba. If the IPO is priced at $100B, Yahoo holds a $24B stake in Alibaba (about $5B below its own current market value). Just need to wait and see. Assumption is that the IPO will be priced in the $60-$70B range which is what the current price is based on. Obviously if it goes higher than that Yahoo will benefit tremendously. Not to mention the $10B stake in Yahoo Japan that is basically growing by the day...

Topic.Title: They should have bought Twitter, not Tumbler

Message.Msg: Would be nice to be able to buy twitter,but its too pricey for yahoo RIGHT NOW

Message.Title: Flickr Update!
Message.Msg: There have been a loud noise from the flickr community, but most of the feedback is like a person complaining because somebody changed the sofa in his living room. A lot of, "where is this or that". Nevertheless App Annie data states that Flickr app when from #60 on video and image to #6, And from a ~#700 overall ranking to #69 today. Not Bad Ha! PS: ALL other new Apps like weather, yahoo home are well above redesign levels and Yahoo Mail redesign app is killing in the ipad (#31 overall and #1 in productivity).

Topic.Title: Flickr Update!

Message.Msg: Ahhh and Tumblr! app went from #10 to #2 on social networking and more impressive from #200 to #24 overall app on iOS. Not Bad Ha!
